issues.summary: MultiProcess executor reuses the same worker process when sequentially executing activities in a workflow, instead of distributing them across different processes as expected. The issue is resolved when activities run concurrently rather than sequentially.

issues.title: [Bug] `ScheduleOverlapPolicy` has broken __eq__
issues.author: andersio
issues.summary: ScheduleOverlapPolicy enum has broken __eq__ method that incorrectly returns True when comparing different enum values. The issue is caused by ScheduleOverlapPolicy being both a dataclass and an IntEnum, causing comparison logic to malfunction.

issues.title: Show update handler and ID in logging context
issues.author: drewhoskins-temporal
issues.summary: Request to include update handler and ID information in logging context for better observability and debugging of update handlers in Python SDK.

issues.title: [Feature Request] OpenTelemetry Metrics OLTP/HTTP support
issues.author: slingshotsys
issues.summary: Python SDK lacks support for OpenTelemetry metrics export via OTLP/HTTP protocol. Currently only OTLP/gRPC is supported, preventing integration with services like Pydantic Logfire that require HTTP endpoints.

issues.title: [Bug] _convert_payloads fails with One or more mappers failed to initialize
issues.author: rakesh-163
issues.summary: Activity fails with payload conversion error when SQLModel objects with table=True are used as return values. The error references os.environ.get access from within workflow context, though this appears to be a side effect of SQLAlchemy mapper initialization rather than direct activity code.

issues.title: UpdateWithStart SDK API
issues.author: drewhoskins-temporal
issues.summary: Request to expose update-with-start operations through the Python SDK API. This feature allows combining update and start workflow operations, similar to existing UpdateWithStart functionality in other Temporal SDKs.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Fix quinn-proto Vulnerability by Updating Rust Package to Version 0.11.7
issues.author: rbtbar
issues.summary: Security vulnerability in quinn-proto Rust dependency affecting the Python SDK. Update to version 0.11.7 to apply necessary security patches for advisories GHSA-vr26-jcq5-fjj8 and RUSTSEC-2024-0373.

issues.title: [Bug] Sending a query that is not registered in the workflow results in an "Encoded failure" when encode_common_attributes=True
issues.author: antmendoza
issues.summary: When encode_common_attributes=True is set on the failure converter, querying an unregistered workflow query or the internal list query returns an "Encoded failure" error instead of a proper failure response. The UI's query listing feature fails because it relies on the internal query type which also encounters this encoding issue.

issues.title: [Bug] Operation was canceled when start_workflow
issues.author: duy-nguyen-ts
issues.summary: User experiences intermittent 'operation was canceled' errors when calling start_workflow with multiple concurrent requests. Out of 10 workflows, only 6 succeed while 4 fail with RPC errors, with no consistent reproduction pattern.

issues.title: Importing 3rd party package `ruamel.yaml` anywhere causes failure to validate workflow
issues.author: adamh-oai
issues.summary: Importing third-party packages like ruamel.yaml that patch stdlib modules (e.g., datetime) causes workflow validation to fail in the sandbox. The issue occurs because the SDK proxies datetime to enforce determinism, but library patches interact unexpectedly with these proxies, resulting in 'unhashable type' errors.

issues.title: [Bug] Windows 3.12.5 builds are broken
issues.author: dandavison
issues.summary: Windows builds for Python 3.12.5 fail during linking with 'cannot open input file python3.lib' error. The linker cannot find the required Python library file on Windows, preventing successful compilation.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Add type-level tests
issues.author: dandavison
issues.summary: Request to add type-level testing capabilities to verify that mypy and pyright type checkers enforce the desired type constraints, and to prevent future regressions in type safety.

issues.title: Cannot execute workflow update from a temporal activity
issues.author: sytdas
issues.summary: User encountered a 'limit on number of total updates has been reached (2000)' error when attempting to execute a workflow update from within a temporal activity. The issue was triggered when trying to send an update from a scheduled workflow's activity to a long-running workflow.

issues.title: [Feature Request] OpenTelemetry export fails over TLS
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: OpenTelemetry export fails when using TLS connections. This is a feature request to update the Python SDK to match a fix implemented in sdk-core.

issues.title: [Bug] Worker hangs after polling workflow task queue
issues.author: kelkawi-a
issues.summary: Worker hangs indefinitely when polling workflow task queue with incorrect authorization token. The worker receives 504 Gateway Timeout errors and PermissionDenied responses, eventually raising a RuntimeError without properly recovering or shutting down gracefully.

issues.title: [Bug] workflow.upsert_search_attributes() will bork SDK on empty inputs
issues.author: irdbl
issues.summary: Calling workflow.upsert_search_attributes() with an empty list causes the SDK to crash with an unclear "malformed workflow completion" error instead of handling the empty input gracefully or providing a helpful validation error.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Support serialization of `datetime` values in default JSON converter
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Add support for serializing and deserializing `datetime` values in the default JSON converter using ISO 8601 format.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Fix pyright type-checking violations
issues.author: dandavison
issues.summary: Fix pyright type-checking violations that were previously excluded from CI validation. This involves addressing type-checking issues to remove the exclusion list and achieve full type compliance.

issues.title: [Bug] RPCStatusCode.ALREADY_EXISTS can be swallowed
issues.author: dandavison
issues.summary: RPCStatusCode.ALREADY_EXISTS can be swallowed due to an unhandled execution branch in the client code, causing errors to be lost silently.

issues.title: [Bug] unable to install temporal on python 3.11-alpine3.16
issues.author: hansraj1999
issues.summary: Installation of temporalio package fails on Python 3.11 Alpine Linux due to missing protoc-wheel-0 dependency. The SDK maintainers do not provide pre-built Alpine/musl binaries, requiring users to build from source.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Create official Pydantic contrib module
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Create an official Pydantic contrib module for the Python SDK to provide seamless integration with Pydantic models, including JSON encoding payload converters, data converters, and datetime handling support.

issues.title: [Bug] Workflow cancellation can be swallowed
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: In Python SDK, workflow cancellation can be swallowed when an activity completes during the cancellation request, particularly with short-lived activities. The issue appears to be related to Python asyncio's behavior where cancellation can be lost if the awaited operation completes and swallows the cancellation signal.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Improve wait_condition semantics
issues.author: dandavison
issues.summary: The wait_condition semantics in Python SDK cause unexpected behavior when multiple coroutines wait on the same condition. When the condition becomes true, all waiting coroutines wake up simultaneously, but the condition may change before all of them execute their subsequent code, causing some to see a different state than expected.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Investigate adding allure to GitHub Actions CI workflows
issues.author: dandavison
issues.summary: Feature request to investigate integrating Allure reporting framework into the Python SDK's GitHub Actions CI workflows. The reporting tool offers historical correlation of test results across runs, potentially improving test visibility and debugging.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Better error message when trying to upsert a datetime search attribute with non-tz-aware datetime.
issues.author: dandavison
issues.summary: The SDK should provide a helpful error message when users try to upsert a datetime search attribute with a timezone-naive datetime object, instead of letting the server fail the Workflow Task Completion.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Support a `limit` parameter in `replay_workflows` and `workflow_replay_iterator`
issues.author: Sushisource
issues.summary: Add a `limit` parameter to `replay_workflows` and `workflow_replay_iterator` functions to support early stopping when working with async iterators, addressing the limitation that the API only supports page sizes without a LIMIT clause.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Make payload conversion errors on workflow input more discriminable
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to improve error handling for payload conversion failures on workflow input by making the error type more discriminable and allowing it to be set on workflow_failure_exception_types, with consideration for reusing this exception across other payload conversion error locations.

issues.title: [Bug] Prevent hot-reload of workflow definitions from disk
issues.author: dandavison
issues.summary: Python worker unintentionally hot-reloads workflow definitions from disk on every workflow run or CAN instead of requiring process restart, creating production deployment risks where users expect file overwrites to only take effect after process restart.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Consider aligning activation job application with TS changes
issues.author: Sushisource
issues.summary: Align Python SDK's activation job application model with TypeScript SDK by applying all jobs in a single batch before running the event loop, instead of multiple batches. This aligns with the Core-based language pattern where state is updated synchronously before routines execute.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Investigate/document how to use PyCharm debugger with workflows
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to investigate and document how to use PyCharm debugger with Temporal workflows. PyCharm's asyncio debugging has compatibility issues with the SDK's custom asyncio implementation, requiring investigation and documentation of workarounds.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Reset workflow feature
issues.author: burbaljaka
issues.summary: User requests a workflow reset feature for the Python SDK similar to other Temporal SDKs. The maintainer clarifies that workflow reset is intentionally exposed only via raw gRPC calls through workflow_service for advanced users, not as a high-level API.

issues.title: Workflow-init support
issues.author: drewhoskins-temporal
issues.summary: Add a workflow initialization method that runs before signals and updates are processed, allowing handlers to use guaranteed initialized values.

issues.title: [Bug] Cant build wheel temporalio when installing with pip
issues.author: ichsansaid
issues.summary: pip install fails to build wheels for temporalio on Windows, showing compilation errors despite having Rust compiler installed. The user receives build failure messages when attempting to install the package.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Support schedule search attribute update
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to support schedule search attribute updates in the Python SDK, aligning with implementations in other SDKs like Go.

issues.title: [Bug] Activity logger context not populated when `activity_info_on_message` False
issues.author: TheCodeWrangler
issues.summary: Activity logger context is not populated when `activity_info_on_message` is False, even when `activity_info_on_extra` is True. The bug occurs because the code accesses `_logger_details` instead of `logger_details`, preventing lazy population of logger context.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Update schedule default values
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Update the default schedule retention period in the Python SDK from its current value to 1 year to match the server-side default, with consideration for making it a server-side default instead of client-side.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Default Workflow\Activity Params In Declaration
issues.author: ytaben
issues.summary: Feature request to allow workflow and activity parameters (timeouts, retry policies, task queues, etc.) to be specified at the definition/declaration site rather than requiring specification at every call site. The SDK would use call-site values first and fall back to declaration defaults.

issues.title: [Feature Request] add "id_conflict_policy" arg for "execute_child_workflow"
issues.author: johnny-smitherson
issues.summary: Feature request to add `id_conflict_policy` argument to `execute_child_workflow()` for Python SDK, similar to the parameter recently added for other workflow start methods. The feature would reduce boilerplate try/except error handling when starting child workflows.

issues.title: [Bug] workflow.start_child_workflow() behaving differently than workflow.execute_child_workflow() in tests
issues.author: cpg1111
issues.summary: User reported that `workflow.start_child_workflow()` throws `InvalidStateError` or blocks indefinitely in tests, while `workflow.execute_child_workflow()` works fine. The issue was resolved by clarifying that `ChildWorkflowHandle` is an `asyncio.Task` and should be awaited directly rather than calling `.result()`.

issues.title: [Bug] Test flake, may be sandbox import issue
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Intermittent test failure on Python 3.8 during workflow import validation, suspected to be related to a known Python reimporting issue with sandbox imports.

issues.title: Unfinished handlers: continue-as-new and dynamic handlers
issues.author: dandavison
issues.summary: PR #556 was incomplete - it failed to address dynamic handlers and didn't include tests verifying that warnings are emitted when continue-as-new is used. This issue tracks the need to complete this work.

issues.title: Tweak error message on workflow cancellation
issues.author: dandavison
issues.summary: Workflow cancellation currently results in a generic 'workflow execution failed' error message. The author initially suggested changing it to 'workflow execution cancelled' but later clarified this isn't appropriate since the cancellation exception is contained as the cause of the outer exception.

issues.title: activity returning dict object forcefully
issues.author: MaazBinMusa
issues.summary: Activity returning dict instead of dataclass when called via string name. User was forced to manually convert the returned dict to the expected dataclass type. Issue was resolved by specifying the result_type parameter or using execute_activity_method.

issues.title: [Bug] cibuildwheel using older manylinux 2014 images using out of date Centos 7 repo
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: The cibuildwheel configuration is using an outdated manylinux2014 image (from March 2024) with an expired CentOS 7 repository mirror, causing build failures. Updating cibuildwheel to a newer version with updated repositories should resolve this.

issues.title: [Feature Request] better workflow testing in multi-worker scenarios
issues.author: reith
issues.summary: User requests better support for testing workflows that execute activities across multiple task queues. Current approach requires subclassing workflows in tests to override task queue names, and there's no straightforward way to run multiple workers in test scenarios.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Workflow cancellation should cancel handler executions
issues.author: dandavison
issues.summary: Workflow cancellation does not cancel in-progress signal/update handler executions. Clients receive a generic 'workflow execution already completed' exception instead of a cancellation-specific error, making it unclear that the update was canceled due to workflow cancellation.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Support "query" when listing schedules
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Request to add query support when listing schedules in the Python SDK, similar to the existing query functionality available for listing workflows.

issues.title: [Bug] Upserting datetime search attribute fails
issues.author: irdbl
issues.summary: Upserting a datetime search attribute fails because the Python SDK doesn't format the datetime with a timezone. The server requires timezone information in the ISO 8601 format (with 'Z' suffix for UTC), but the SDK was sending the datetime without it, causing an InvalidArgument error.

issues.title: [Bug] Fix flaky tests
issues.author: dandavison
issues.summary: Test suite contains multiple flaky tests that fail intermittently across different environments and test runs, including timeouts, pickling errors, and process failures.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Replace BuildJet ARM runner with GH runner
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to replace BuildJet ARM runner with GitHub's native ARM runners in the Python SDK CI/CD pipeline, now that GitHub has made ARM runners available.

issues.title: [Bug] Converting payloads and other exception-possible actions done after command creation
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Activity command creation occurs before parameter serialization, causing half-complete commands to be sent to Core if serialization fails and users treat the error as an application error rather than a task failure.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Update test running to replay
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Request to improve test workflow coverage by implementing automatic replay functionality and cache-less test runs to catch more issues during testing.

issues.title: [Bug] Workflow Task Timeout only supports upto 2 minutes
issues.author: mrafay0
issues.summary: User reported that workflow task timeout is capped at 2 minutes and cannot be set higher, even though they tried to set it to 15 minutes. The maintainer clarified this is a server-enforced maximum timeout by design, not a Python SDK limitation.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Propagate changes made with updated Rust dependencies
issues.author: kelkawi-a
issues.summary: Rust dependency updates from PR #520 need to be released to pip to address security vulnerabilities. Users currently receive an outdated version of the Python SDK on pip that still contains the vulnerable dependencies.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Accept search attributes in dev server startup
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Add support for accepting search attributes in dev server startup configuration for the Python SDK. Users should be able to set search attributes through dev server options that translate to CLI --search-attribute calls.

issues.title: Document workflow-friendly concurrency control
issues.author: drewhoskins-temporal
issues.summary: Document and add tests confirming that asyncio.Lock and asyncio.Semaphore can be used safely in Python workflows to control interleaving of signal and update handlers with the main workflow coroutine.

issues.title: Testing
issues.author: drewhoskins-temporal
issues.summary: This is a placeholder testing issue with minimal content containing only the word 'testing'.

issues.title: Testing
issues.author: drewhoskins-temporal
issues.summary: Minimal issue with title 'Testing' and single word body 'testing'. Appears to be a placeholder or test issue with no substantive content describing a problem or request.

issues.title: [Bug] Generating protos via docker and manually are causing different whitespace inside of multi-paragraph docs
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Docker-based proto generation produces different whitespace in multi-paragraph documentation compared to manual generation outside the container, causing CI diff checks to fail.

issues.title: Expose UpdateID in an update handler
issues.author: drewhoskins-temporal
issues.summary: Request to expose UpdateID in update handlers to allow users to generate unique idempotent primary keys for their update handler logic.

issues.title: [Bug] Exception in converter encoding doesn't propagate as expected
issues.author: assafz-q
issues.summary: When an exception occurs during data converter encoding in activity parameters, it doesn't propagate properly as a workflow failure. Instead, an incomplete activity command is sent to the server with a missing task queue name, causing a warning and allowing the workflow to timeout instead of failing immediately.

issues.title: Provide methods to wait for all handlers to finish
issues.author: drewhoskins-temporal
issues.summary: Users need methods to wait for all remaining handlers to complete when continuing as new or exiting a workflow. The SDK should provide explicit control over handler completion behavior.

issues.title: Warn or error when update handlers dangle across CAN or workflow exit
issues.author: drewhoskins-temporal
issues.summary: Add warning or error when update handlers are left dangling across Continues-as-New (CAN) or workflow exit to prevent resource leaks and unexpected behavior. The issue recommends providing guidance on await-all-handlers or drop-all-handlers methods.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Clarify exception on return type decoding failure
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Improve error messages when workflow or activity return type decoding fails. Currently shows generic 'Failed decoding arguments' message; should specify what failed to decode (return value vs encoding) and which child workflow or activity was affected.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Turn invalid asyncio call warnings into errors
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Convert non-deterministic asyncio call warnings into hard errors for asyncio.as_completed() and asyncio.wait() invoked in workflows, following a deprecation period after issue #533.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Call Core worker.validate
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Add validation on worker start/run using Core's validate function to ensure configuration is correct and provide early error feedback to users.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Include stack trace on deadlock detection exception
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Add stack trace information to deadlock detection exceptions in the Python SDK. Currently, deadlock errors are raised without stack trace context, making debugging difficult.

issues.title: Wrap GRPC::CANCELED and DEADLINE_EXCEEDED in an SDK Timeout exception for Update
issues.author: drewhoskins-temporal
issues.summary: Wrap GRPC CANCELED and DEADLINE_EXCEEDED exceptions in a SDK-specific Timeout exception for Update operations so users only need to catch one predictable exception type.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Do not set workflow completion until after all coroutines have settled in the task
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to defer workflow completion until after all coroutines have settled in the task, ensuring proper cleanup and finalization of async operations before marking the workflow as complete.

issues.title: [Bug] Can crash SDK with non-halting workflow
issues.author: dandavison
issues.summary: A non-halting workflow with concurrent wait_condition tasks causes a RuntimeError when the SDK tries to generate a stack trace, due to iterating over a set that changes size during iteration.

issues.title: [Bug] Returning given payload object in codec causes issues
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: A codec that returns the same payload object it was given on decode causes issues due to a bug in how the original payload is updated. This can lead to unexpected behavior when codecs attempt to reuse payload objects.

issues.title: [Bug] Make sure `is_replaying` is `True` upon eviction, and only throw certain exception types out on eviction
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: During workflow eviction, exceptions can be caught in finally/except blocks allowing side effects like logging when is_replaying should be True. Need to set is_replaying=True during eviction and throw WorkflowEvictingException to prevent user code from executing side effects.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Cloud Operations API Client
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Add a separate Cloud Operations API client for the Python SDK using cloud protos, marked as experimental. This feature requires sdk-core support and follows similar implementations in Go SDK.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Update rustls and mio in Rust dependencies
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Update outdated Rust dependencies (rustls, mio, and h2) in the Python SDK to address security vulnerabilities flagged by security scans, even though the SDK is not directly affected.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Investigate asyncio.as_completed and asyncio.wait usage of `set` as non-deterministic
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Investigate non-deterministic behavior in asyncio.as_completed and asyncio.wait due to their use of set, either provide deterministic alternatives or document the risk and add warnings.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Make start_update users aware that it's synchronous w/ worker
issues.author: drewhoskins-temporal
issues.summary: Feature request to make start_update users aware that it's synchronous with the worker. Related to broader SDK awareness issues documented in the features repository.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Client replacement in worker
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to enable replacing the worker's client with a new one that may have different connection options, such as a new TLS certificate.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Reload client certificate
issues.author: pvcnt
issues.summary: User needs ability to reload short-lived client certificates without restarting the client. Solution implemented: users can replace the worker's client with a newly connected client containing updated TLS configuration.

issues.title: Expose defaultConnection() method to switch between localhost and cloud based on env
issues.author: josh-berry
issues.summary: Add a defaultConnection() method that dynamically switches between localhost and Temporal Cloud based on environment variables, enabling samples and documentation to easily demonstrate both local and cloud deployments.

issues.title: Support for WorkflowIdConflictPolicy
issues.author: josh-berry
issues.summary: Request to add support for WorkflowIdConflictPolicy in the Python SDK, specifically for child workflows. This feature allows customization of how the system handles workflow ID conflicts when starting new workflows.

issues.title: [Bug] Do not mutate `extra` in activity/workflow loggers
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: The logger mutates the `extra` dictionary passed to it without creating a copy first, which modifies the caller's original dictionary. This is a side effect that should be avoided.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Add extra context on task failure logs
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to add extra context on task failure logs for workflows and activities in Python SDK, similar to what's provided in regular workflow/activity logger calls.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Check Protobuf 5.x Support
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to verify and support Protocol Buffers 5.x in the Python SDK. The issue was resolved by upgrading to protobuf 3.13, which only works with protobuf 5.x, and CI is now passing with this configuration.

issues.title: [Bug] Fix explanation of Pydantic datetime issue
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: The README incorrectly instructs users to mark Pydantic datetime fields as passthrough when they should be marked as unrestricted. The documentation needs correction and should include a code snippet example from the samples repository.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Use macOS M1/ARM runners for all SDK CI
issues.author: Quinn-With-Two-Ns
issues.summary: Request to enable macOS M1/ARM runners for all Python SDK CI builds. This follows a feature request across the Temporal organization to support Apple Silicon architecture testing.

issues.title: [Bug] Commands sent during finally of a cache eviction may cross workflow contexts
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: During garbage collection, finally clauses in Python workflows execute on a different event loop, causing commands to cross workflow contexts. This leads to activities from one workflow incorrectly executing in another workflow, resulting in non-determinism errors.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Support metric option for using seconds (and other recent core metric changes)
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to expose the `use_seconds_for_duration` option from sdk-core PR #706 for Prometheus metrics in the Python SDK, along with tests for duration values as seconds and ability to set duration values in custom metrics.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Make log "extra" have dict instead of info
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Change the logging extra field to use dict-based temporal_activity and temporal_workflow instead of info data classes, improving compatibility with standard loggers.

issues.title: [Bug] Fix typo in restriction set
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: A typo in the workflow sandbox restrictions file at line 602 uses a space instead of a comma, which needs to be corrected.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Allow workflow logger to opt-out of sandboxing
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Users with advanced logger handlers that don't work in sandbox mode need a way to opt-out of sandboxing for the workflow logger. The request is to add a helper function that allows wrapping logger process calls in unrestricted sandbox context.

issues.title: [Feature Request] SDK should not return an update handle if the update has not reached the desired state
issues.author: Quinn-With-Two-Ns
issues.summary: SDK should not return an update handle if the update has not reached the desired state. This feature request addresses inconsistent behavior where update handles are returned prematurely.

issues.title: [Feature Request] SDK clients should set a UpdateID on any update request even if the user did not specify one
issues.author: Quinn-With-Two-Ns
issues.summary: SDK clients should automatically set an UpdateID on update requests even when users don't explicitly specify one, ensuring consistent update handling across the SDK.

issues.title: [Feature Request] API key client option
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Request to add API key client option to the Python SDK, referencing the features issue #426 for implementation details.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Reflection-based payload codec test to ensure all non-search-attribute payloads are covered
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Add reflection-based payload codec tests to Python SDK to ensure all non-search-attribute payloads are covered by codec conversion, similar to existing tests in the .NET SDK.

issues.title: [Bug] Updates not run through data converters
issues.author: Sushisource
issues.summary: Update handler inputs and responses are not being processed through payload converters and codecs, causing data serialization inconsistencies.

issues.title: [Bug] Failed during multiprocess queue poll for heartbeat
issues.author: wilsoniya
issues.summary: In heavily-loaded multiprocess workers, heartbeat queue polling times out when activities send heartbeats too frequently or with complex serialized details, causing the parent process to hang and stop processing further heartbeats, which fills the queue and blocks activity liveness.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Clarify in README that --all-extras is needed for build
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Documentation enhancement to clarify that `poetry install --all-extras` is required for building the Python SDK, and potentially document that a newer version of pip is needed.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Clarify option immutability for application failures
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Add clarification to SDK documentation that options on application failures are not mutated by the server. Specifically, non-retryable errors are client-side error options, not server-provided failures.

issues.title: Expose next retry delay on Application Failure in all SDKs
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: Add support for exposing the next retry delay field on ApplicationFailureInfo across all SDKs. The API now supports specifying retry delays on activity failures, and the Python SDK needs to expose this capability.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Support workflow metadata query
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to support workflow metadata query in the Python SDK, similar to capabilities being developed across Temporal SDKs.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Support disabling host verification
issues.author: BrianKopp
issues.summary: Feature request to support disabling TLS host verification in the Python SDK to enable testing with self-signed certificates. Users need this capability to connect to Temporal clusters with generic self-generated TLS certificates, similar to functionality available in other SDKs and the CLI.

issues.title: [Bug] Handle possibility of update-before-start
issues.author: Sushisource
issues.summary: Updates can be processed before the first workflow code executes if they arrive in the same task as the start workflow message. The SDK needs to buffer updates similar to how other SDKs handle this, or reorder activation job processing to prevent updates from executing before workflow initialization.

issues.title: [Bug] Worker hangs after polling error
issues.author: ndtretyak
issues.summary: Worker process hangs indefinitely after encountering a polling error (PermissionDenied) during task retrieval from the server. The worker logs the error but fails to properly shut down, leaving the process in a hung state.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Schedule creation should create tracing span by default
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to automatically create tracing spans for schedule creation in the Python SDK. When the tracing interceptor is enabled, schedules should create spans and set them on workflow headers when starting workflows, with an opt-out option.

issues.title: [Bug] Parent packages of a package are automatically imported via the Sandbox
issues.author: rcomesan
issues.summary: When importing a workflow from a nested package, parent package __init__.py files are implicitly imported via the sandbox, causing errors if those files contain non-deterministic code. Users expect only the specific workflow module to be imported.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Decode json/plain as json/protobuf if type_hint is a subclass of protobuf.Message
issues.author: ndtretyak
issues.summary: User requests that JSONPlainPayloadConverter handle protobuf-encoded JSON payloads when type hints are protobuf.Message subclasses, enabling workflows started via tctl with json/plain encoding to work with protobuf arguments.

issues.title: upsert_search_attribute does not insert new attributes
issues.author: ndtretyak
issues.summary: The upsert_search_attribute method fails with StopIteration error when attempting to add new SearchAttribute that don't exist in the initial SearchAttributes set. This regression appeared in SDK 1.4.0.

issues.title: pathlib RestrictedWorkflowAccessError
issues.author: vamsu
issues.summary: User encounters RestrictedWorkflowAccessError when using pathlib.Path.resolve() inside a workflow. The sandbox prevents access to pathlib methods, and the user seeks ways to disable restrictions while maintaining deterministic behavior.

issues.title: [Bug] Scheduled workflow did not receive OpenTelemetry tracing
issues.author: Holi0317
issues.summary: OpenTelemetry tracing is not generated or propagated for scheduled workflow executions in the Python SDK. When workflows are triggered by Temporal schedules, trace IDs are broken across activities, unlike manually invoked workflows which maintain consistent trace IDs.

issues.title: [Bug] Cut a new release please
issues.author: arlyon
issues.summary: User encountered deprecation warnings and breaking API changes in Python SDK 1.4.0, requiring migration of their codebase. They request a new release with improved documentation and a longer transition period for deprecated APIs.

issues.title: [Bug] Wrong line number in workflow.logger
issues.author: ndtretyak
issues.summary: The workflow.logger incorrectly reports line numbers pointing to the LoggingAdapter.log method instead of the actual calling code. This makes it difficult to trace where log messages originate in workflow code.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Configurable workflow failure exception types
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Add configurable workflow failure exception types to the Worker constructor and workflow decorators, allowing users to specify which exception types should be treated as workflow failures. Currently needed to support feature parity across SDKs.

issues.title: [Bug] delete_workflow_execution not properly available on workflow_service
issues.author: RonaldGalea
issues.summary: The delete_workflow_execution RPC call was not properly available on the workflow_service in the Python SDK, throwing a ValueError when called. The issue was caused by the call being mistakenly placed on operator_service in the Rust side.

issues.title: [Bug] Fix lint warnings for Client.execute_workflow
issues.author: lethe3000
issues.summary: PyCharm IDE shows lint warnings when calling client.execute_workflow() with a parameterless workflow, even though the code is valid and passes other type checkers like Pyright.

issues.title: [Bug] Coroutine Raised StopIteration when triggering  workflow execution from CLI for workflows which call workflow.upsert_search_attributes
issues.author: alonwengierko
issues.summary: Upgrading Python SDK from 1.3.0 to 1.4.0 causes a 'coroutine raised StopIteration' error when triggering workflows that call workflow.upsert_search_attributes via CLI. The issue was fixed in PR #440 but not yet released at the time of reporting.

issues.title: [Bug] GeneratorExit possibly causing issues on context detach in OTel finally
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: GeneratorExit exceptions are causing context detach failures in OpenTelemetry integration when coroutines are garbage collected. The issue occurs when the garbage collector wakes up a coroutine on a different thread, causing token validation errors during context cleanup in the finally block.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Allow continue as new from update handler
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to enable continue-as-new workflow capability from within update handlers in the Python SDK, allowing workflows to restart with new input parameters without losing context.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Allow `RawValue` to be used for Search Attibute Upsert
issues.author: Sushisource
issues.summary: Feature request to allow RawValue objects to be used as search attribute values during upsert operations. This capability is needed for testing purposes and for workflows that need to transfer search attributes between different workflow instances.

issues.title: [Bug] Ensure continue as new raised from update handler is a task failure
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: A continue_as_new exception raised from an update handler may be swallowed as an uncaught exception in a task, rather than being properly handled as a task failure.

issues.title: [Bug] Overload checking not catching bad parameters anymore
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: MyPy type checking is not catching invalid single-parameter workflow calls where no parameter is provided. This is a regression in type safety that affects multiple areas of the SDK.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Remove activation job sorting and confirm update order
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Remove redundant activation job sorting from the Python SDK workflow instance since the core SDK now handles this. Add a test to verify that interleaved updates and signals maintain their order after the change.

issues.title: [Bug] Exception raise from workflow causes indefinite retry
issues.author: Holi0317
issues.summary: Raising a non-Temporal exception in a workflow causes indefinite workflow task retries instead of failing the workflow execution. The Python SDK treats all non-Temporal exceptions as retriable workflow task failures, contradicting the documented default behavior that workflows should not retry by default.

issues.title: [Bug] asyncio.wait is non-deterministic when used with coroutines instead of tasks
issues.author: ntessman-capsule
issues.summary: asyncio.wait() is non-deterministic when passed coroutines instead of tasks, causing activity results to be randomly reassigned across concurrent executions. This occurs because asyncio.wait() internally converts coroutines to a set, which has no ordering guarantees.

issues.title: [Bug] dataclasses require even defaulted fields in the JSON dict
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Dataclass deserialization requires all fields to be present in JSON dict, including those with default values. This is overly strict and should allow omitting fields that have defaults.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Implement `is_running` for `_WorkflowInstanceImpl`
issues.author: tomasfarias
issues.summary: Feature request to implement `is_running` method on the Temporal Python workflow event loop to better conform to `AbstractEventLoop` interface. The method is needed for compatibility with libraries like aiokafka and aiohttp that expect this standard asyncio method to be implemented.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Add usedforsecurity=False for build-ID MD5 use
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Add usedforsecurity=False parameter to MD5 hash function calls used for build ID generation in Python 3.9+. This addresses Python 3.9's requirement to explicitly mark non-security uses of cryptographic functions.

issues.title: [Feature Request] add get update handle and set run ID
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Add ability to get an update handle from a workflow handle. Ensure update handles use the returned run ID when starting updates, and provide clear documentation about consequences of getting update handles on workflow handles without a run ID.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Move from black/isort to Ruff
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Migrate Python SDK from black/isort to Ruff for code formatting and import sorting. This tool consolidation was successfully tested in the samples-python repository and should be applied to the main SDK.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Make start_update/execute_update work with vscode/pyright and add pyright to CI
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Pyright/VSCode type checker fails with multi-parameter update methods due to typing issues. Need to simplify type hints for start_update/execute_update and add Pyright to CI alongside MyPy.

issues.title: [Bug] README issues
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: README contains multiple documentation issues: incorrect class initialization signature, missing poetry install flags for running tests, and unclear pip version requirements for development setup.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Ensure activity failure warning log has contextual workflow information
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Activity failure warning logs for not-found activities lack contextual workflow information because these activities never enter the activity context. This feature request seeks to ensure that activity failure warnings include relevant workflow information for better debugging and observability.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Add `temporalio.workflow.in_workflow()` call
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Request to add an `in_workflow()` function to the Python SDK that allows code to detect if it's running within a workflow context, similar to Java's `isWorkflowThread()` and TypeScript's `inWorkflowContext()`. The implementer acknowledges this is not technically unsafe despite potentially being placed in an unsafe module.

issues.title: [Bug] protoc-wheel-0 dev dependency causing issues when building on musl-based distros like Alpine
issues.author: bryanlalexander
issues.summary: The protoc-wheel-0 dev dependency is unavailable on PyPI for musl-based distributions like Alpine Linux, preventing installation of temporalio package. This affects users building on Alpine and other musl-based systems that lack pre-built wheels for protoc-wheel-0.

issues.title: Remove OutboundInterceptor.poll_workflow_update
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Remove the OutboundInterceptor.poll_workflow_update method as it doesn't need to be interceptable, similar to how getting a workflow result is not interceptable.

issues.title: Remove timeout from WorkflowUpdateHandle.result
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Remove the timeout parameter from WorkflowUpdateHandle.result since users can achieve timeout behavior using asyncio.wait_for if needed, and the API should be consistent with WorkflowHandle.result which doesn't have a timeout parameter.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Add utility or at least sample to incorporate core logs into Python logging
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Add a utility or sample code demonstrating how to integrate Temporal core logs into Python's standard logging framework using the new log forwarding feature introduced in #405.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Add StartDelay to Workflow Options
issues.author: tlalfano
issues.summary: Feature request to expose StartDelay option in Workflow Options, allowing workflows to be scheduled with a delay before execution begins.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Trigger Activity Retry when workflow got signal
issues.author: devery59
issues.summary: User wants to trigger activity retry logic when a workflow receives a signal that indicates failure or timeout. They're looking for a Temporal-idiomatic way to retry failed activities based on signal conditions rather than manually implementing retry loops.

issues.title: [Bug] Older Python versions cannot auto-import activity return class in sandbox
issues.author: devery59
issues.summary: Custom dataclass return types from activities fail to deserialize in Python 3.9 with a KeyError during sandbox import resolution, while the same code works in Python 3.11. The issue appears to be related to how the workflow sandbox importer handles automatic type resolution for older Python versions.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Drop 3.7 support, update CI to Python 3.12, and other build improvements
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Drop Python 3.7 support, update to minimum Python 3.8, and add Python 3.12 to CI. Also update build tooling versions (setuptools-rust, cibuildwheel) and re-investigate build system hacks.

issues.title: [Bug] Client may not be reconnecting on server shutdown/restart
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Clients may not be auto-reconnecting when the server shuts down and restarts. Investigation and testing confirmed that clients do recover after server restart, though the issue was initially unconfirmed.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Client keep alive support
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Request to expose client keep-alive options in the Python SDK. The functionality is already enabled by default in the SDK core, requiring only the addition of configuration options.

issues.title: [Bug] Compilation fails for ARCH `s390x` and `ppc64el`
issues.author: troyanov
issues.summary: Cross-compilation for s390x and ppc64el architectures fails due to ring v0.16.20 not supporting these platforms. The issue is in a transitive dependency (rustls -> ring) and was resolved by updating rustls to v0.21.8.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Support ExceptionGroup traceback
issues.author: jashandeep-sohi
issues.summary: User requests support for Python's ExceptionGroup traceback in workflows using asyncio.TaskGroup. When an ExceptionGroup is raised, its sub-exception tracebacks are missing from the stack_trace field, making debugging harder.

issues.title: PoC - Static analyzer for Python
issues.author: josh-berry
issues.summary: Design and implement a static analyzer for Python SDK to detect thread-blocking calls in async functions and illegal workflow calls. Discussion explores using mypy plugins, Pyright, or the emerging Ruff type-checker for implementation.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Eager workflow start
issues.author: antlai-temporal
issues.summary: Add support for Eager Workflow Start in the Python SDK, a performance optimization that allows clients to directly schedule the first workflow task to a local worker, reducing latency. This feature is already supported in Java and Go SDKs and depends on Core implementation.

issues.title: [Bug] Client stuck connecting or starting a workflow
issues.author: KundaPanda
issues.summary: Client hangs when connecting in a new process after a client was created in the current process. The issue occurs during process forking (e.g., in gunicorn), which is not supported by the SDK due to Rust runtime limitations.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Provide last result and last failure to workflows
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to provide the last result and last failure from previous workflow executions to workflows, allowing access to retry state information similar to features implemented in other SDKs.

issues.title: tonic-0.9.2.crate: 1 vulnerabilities (highest severity is: 7.5) - autoclosed
issues.author: app/mend-for-github-com
issues.summary: Transitive dependency vulnerability in rustls-webpki-0.101.4 (CVSS 7.5) causing potential CPU denial of service in certificate path building. Issue was automatically closed after the vulnerable library was removed from the dependency tree.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Typed search attributes
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to implement typed search attributes for the Python SDK, allowing developers to use type-safe search attributes in workflows. This work builds on a proposal and was started in a related issue.

issues.title: Document that time skipping test server does not currently work on ARM
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: The test server's time skipping feature does not work on ARM architecture. Users need documentation about this limitation and workarounds such as using Intel/AMD-to-ARM translation on macOS or non-ARM Linux.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Warn when non-static activity method registered as static
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to add a warning when an activity method has `self` as its first parameter but is registered as a static activity, indicating the instance wasn't properly instantiated.

issues.title: [Bug] mTLS doesn't support non-EC private keys
issues.author: dgjustice
issues.summary: mTLS connections fail when using EC private keys instead of PKCS8 format due to an outdated tonic dependency in sdk-core. Users must manually convert their EC private keys to PKCS8 format as a workaround.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Advanced metrics support
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Advanced metrics support feature request for the Python SDK following sdk-core PR #544. Implements missing Prometheus/OpenTelemetry options, metric buffer forwarding, and metrics access from workflows and activities.

issues.title: [Bug] Activity completions may be dropped on worker shutdown
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Activity completions may be dropped when a worker shuts down, especially if the process exits immediately after shutdown returns. This causes activity failures to not be recorded before the worker closes.

issues.title: [Bug] Temporal graceful shutdown does not prevent activity failure
issues.author: jayfjin
issues.summary: Activity fails on SIGTERM despite graceful_shutdown_timeout being set. User suspects the graceful shutdown mechanism isn't properly preventing activity failures during rolling restarts.

issues.title: [Bug] Testing environment overrides set interceptors
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Testing environment incorrectly overrides interceptors configuration due to a variable assignment error. The code should assign config_interceptors to config["interceptors"] instead of the current incorrect assignment.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Make sure OTel baggage propagates properly throughout activities
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: OpenTelemetry baggage is not propagating properly throughout activities in the Python SDK. A test and fix are needed to ensure baggage is properly serialized/rehydrated to and within activities.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Allow use of type hints even if arg count mismatches in case of default params
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Type hints are not used for workflow/activity parameters if the argument count doesn't match the input count, even when extra parameters have default values. This causes parameters to be treated as dicts instead of their intended types when using UI-based workflow starting with fewer arguments.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Default to suggesting threaded activities (and other async helper docs)
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to improve documentation and guidance around threaded activities in Python SDK. The proposal suggests documenting blocking behavior in async code, the debug mode warning, and encouraging use of threaded activities as the default pattern unless users are certain their calls are non-blocking.

issues.title: [Feature Request] TracingInterceptor span kinds
issues.author: northpowered
issues.summary: TracingInterceptor currently creates all spans with kind=INTERNAL, which doesn't provide good service graph visualization in APM tools. This feature request changes span kinds to use CLIENT/SERVER model for better service graph representation.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Log and drop signals that pass the wrong number of arguments
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Handle signals with incorrect argument counts gracefully by logging and dropping them instead of failing the workflow task. Should validate argument count matches the signal definition's parameter requirements.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Metric fowarding support and custom metric support
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to add metric forwarding support and enable custom metric recording in the Python SDK, similar to capabilities in TypeScript SDK and core.

issues.title: [Bug] Cancel received in between awaitables not cancelling workflow
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Workflow cancellation may not be properly handled when a cancel request arrives between two awaitable operations (e.g., between activity completion and child workflow start). The asyncio task may not propagate the cancellation exception at the next await point if the cancel is received while not actively awaiting.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Make all exposed modules be packages
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Request to convert all exposed modules (temporalio.activity, temporalio.workflow, etc.) into packages to better organize code across multiple files and provide clearer control over `__all__` to improve intellisense accuracy by hiding imported items.

issues.title: [Bug] Signals that can't be deserialized should be dropped/ignored
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Python SDK should drop signals that cannot be deserialized, matching behavior in Go and Java SDKs. This prevents errors when signal arguments cannot be properly deserialized.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Support in-workflow OpenTelemetry span creation
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to expose in-workflow OpenTelemetry span creation to users. The issue was quickly resolved after the author discovered the feature already exists at `temporalio.contrib.opentelemetry.workflow.completed_span`.

issues.title: [Bug] Wrong types when using "workflow.unsafe.imports_passed_through"
issues.author: masylum
issues.summary: Type checker Pyright incorrectly reports that activities imported via `workflow.unsafe.imports_passed_through()` should be strings rather than callable functions, breaking type checking for cross-file activity imports.

issues.title: [Python] Workflow update support
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: Add support for workflow updates in the Python SDK, allowing workflows to be updated with new code while preserving their execution state. This feature is blocked on sdk-core implementation.

issues.title: Worker versioning support
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: Request for worker versioning support in the Python SDK to enable rolling deployments and code version management.

issues.title: [Bug] BaseException exceptions are not caught when raised in an activity
issues.author: joshua-auchincloss
issues.summary: BaseException subclasses raised in activities are silently swallowed instead of being properly caught and handled, causing a TypeError that masks the actual error. The SDK only catches Exception subclasses by design, but should handle BaseException more explicitly rather than silently ignoring it.

issues.title: [Bug] Local activity without schedule_to_close_timeout is failing immediately
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Local activities without an explicit schedule_to_close_timeout fail immediately with a timeout error. The SDK was setting 0 seconds execution timeout instead of null, causing premature failure.

issues.title: Remove "similar to Pedantic" from no-generic part of README
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Remove outdated statement about Pydantic support from the README's no-generic section. The statement claiming limited similarity to Pydantic is inaccurate since Pydantic now has limited support in the SDK.

issues.title: Use stable pydoctor version instead of devel version
issues.author: tristanlatr
issues.summary: Replace the custom development version of pydoctor with the stable version now that support for @overload has been released in the stable branch.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Add helper for checking whether exception represents cancellation
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Request for a helper function to check if an exception represents workflow cancellation. Currently users must check multiple exception types (asyncio.CancelledError, temporalio.exceptions.CancelledError, and nested cancellation in ActivityError/ChildWorkflowError) manually.

issues.title: [Bug] GeneratorExit inadvertently caught, and also core timer mismatch
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Two critical issues with workflow execution: GeneratorExit exceptions are caught and not properly propagated when workflows are evicted with caching disabled, and timer IDs become mismatched during workflow re-execution after eviction.

issues.title: [Bug] Python generics for function type hints
issues.author: cloud-sauce
issues.summary: Python SDK fails to deserialize generic dataclasses used as type hints in activity and workflow functions. When using Generic[T] containers, the type resolver cannot properly handle parameterized types like MyContainer[int], causing TypeError during payload conversion.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Temporal exceptions from converters and codecs should fail the workflow not task
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to allow Temporal exceptions from data converters and codecs to fail the entire workflow rather than just the individual task. Conversion failures have been addressed, but codec failure handling requires more implementation work and community consensus.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Remove experimental warning from Schedules
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Remove the experimental warning from Schedules API in Python SDK, bringing it in line with the Go SDK which already had this warning removed.

issues.title: [Bug] Continue as new doesn't work without specifying `task_queue` and `workflow`
issues.author: nathanielobrown
issues.summary: The `workflow.continue_as_new()` method fails when `task_queue` and `workflow` arguments are omitted, causing a 'Missing TaskQueue' error and workflow to hang. The docstring suggests these should default to the current workflow's values.

issues.title: [Bug] If self parameter is type hinted, it is not properly ignored when deserializing parameters
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: When the `self` parameter is type-hinted (e.g., `self: Self`), it is not properly ignored during parameter deserialization, causing it to be incorrectly included in the deserialized arguments.

issues.title: [Bug] await call in async query function would cause the function to return immediately and cause an error on client side
issues.author: orby-will
issues.summary: Using await in async query functions causes the query to return immediately with an empty response error. Queries are read-only operations that cannot contain blocking code or asynchronous workflow calls like wait_condition or timers.

issues.title: [Bug] ScheduleState.limited_actions doc is invalid
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: The ScheduleState.limited_actions documentation incorrectly states it's not allowed on create, when it should be required for remaining_actions to take effect. The API needs validation to ensure limited_actions and remaining_actions fields are consistent on creation.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Support constructing JSONProtoPayloadConverter with google.protobuf.json_format.Parse options
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to support custom options (especially ignoring unknown fields) when constructing JSONProtoPayloadConverter, matching the Go SDK's ProtoJSONPayloadConverterOptions API.

issues.title: [Bug] Retry Policy on start_workflow
issues.author: mbernier
issues.summary: User reported that retry policy's max_interval parameter is not being respected when passed to start_workflow, with intervals doubling unexpectedly. The maintainer was unable to replicate the issue and closed it after the reporter didn't respond with additional details.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Validate type of timedelta() parameters in validate methods?
issues.author: mbernier
issues.summary: User requested runtime type validation in RetryPolicy and similar validate methods to catch cases where timedelta parameters are passed as integers, providing helpful error messages to guide developers.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Log Forwarding Support for python-SDK
issues.author: samuelmakarovskiy
issues.summary: Python SDK lacks log forwarding support for Rust core logs, making it difficult to monitor and aggregate logs in unified logging systems. The Rust core logs use different formatting (with ANSI colors) compared to Python worker logs, and there's a need to forward these logs back to Python for consistent handling.

issues.title: [Bug] Unable to install temporalio within [image: sonarsource/sonar-scanner-cli:4.6] container
issues.author: kaustav1996
issues.summary: temporalio cannot be installed in Alpine Linux containers because protoc-wheel-0 is not available as a pre-built wheel for musl libc. The package's build process requires protoc-wheel-0 as a build dependency, but pip cannot locate it even after manual installation in an Alpine environment.

issues.title: No module named 'temporalio.bridge.temporal_sdk_bridge'
issues.author: arthosdevelops
issues.summary: Import of temporalio module fails with ModuleNotFoundError for 'temporalio.bridge.temporal_sdk_bridge'. The native bridge module is not built during standard installation, requiring explicit build steps.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Fully qualify README logo image URL
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: The README logo image URL needs to be fully qualified so it will display correctly on PyPI package pages instead of only working on GitHub.

issues.title: [Bug] Proxied classes are not properly hashable
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Proxied classes in workflows are raising 'unhashable type' errors for datetime objects despite having `__hash__` defined, indicating a problem with the proxy implementation's hashability.

issues.title: [Bug] Investigate PyGILState_Release issue for client
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: PyGILState_Release error occurs in short-lived client-only processes after execute_workflow completes, possibly related to PyO3's GIL handling during process shutdown or when the Tokio runtime attempts to call Python callbacks after the Python runtime is finalizing.

issues.title: [Feature Request] tokio update for vuln
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Update Tokio dependency to version 1.25 or 1.26 to address a reported vulnerability in the Python SDK's Rust bridge. The fix can be applied via cargo update.

issues.title: [Feature Request] bzip2 update for vuln
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Update bzip2 dependency to address CVE-2023-22895 vulnerability in the Rust bzip2 crate. The vulnerability is transitive through temporal-sdk-core -> zip -> bzip2 dependency chain.

issues.title: [Feature Request] remove_dir_all update for vuln
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Update the remove_dir_all dependency to address a security vulnerability (GHSA-mc8h-8q98-g5hr) in the transitive dependency chain. The vulnerable library is remove_dir_all-0.5.3 which is required by tempfile through the Rust build chain.

issues.title: [Feature Request] bumpalo update for vuln
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Update bumpalo dependency to fix a security vulnerability (RUSTSEC-2022-0078) in the dependency chain of temporal-sdk-core-api. The vulnerable bumpalo-3.11.0 is transitive dependency through multiple layers of Rust crates.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Support for dependency injection (pinject)
issues.author: grizzlybearer
issues.summary: Request for dependency injection support in Python SDK using pinject to manage scoped dependencies (global, customer-specific) for workflows and activities, similar to Spring Boot support in Java SDK.

issues.title: Add API to count workflows
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: Request to add an API to count workflows in the Python SDK. This is a feature request related to a parent issue with more context.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Clarify activity_id parameter is not recommended
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Add documentation clarification that activity_id parameter should not be set in most cases, requiring Temporal team confirmation before use. This aligns with Go SDK documentation practices.

issues.title: Support dynamic activity and workflow implementations
issues.author: vidath
issues.summary: Request to support dynamic loading of activity and workflow implementations at runtime, similar to Java class loader mechanisms. User needs an extension point/factory interface to provide untyped implementations dynamically rather than registering them statically.

issues.title: Add disclaimer about gevent incompatibility
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Add a disclaimer warning users that gevent's monkey patching is incompatible with asyncio and the SDK's custom event loop, until the underlying issue is resolved.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Support result_type on child workflows and activities
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to support result_type parameter on child workflows and activities in the Python SDK, similar to the existing Client.start_workflow functionality. This would allow type-safe result handling across different workflow invocation patterns.

issues.title: [Bug] JSONTypeConverter not applied recursively
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: JSONTypeConverter is not being passed through recursive calls in the value_to_type function, causing JSON type conversion to fail on nested data structures.

issues.title: [Bug] Enum HistoryEventFilterType has no value defined for name 'ValueType'
issues.author: grizzlybearer
issues.summary: Code crashes with AttributeError when trying to access HistoryEventFilterType.ValueType enum value. The issue occurs during workflow history event fetching in the multiprocess activity example. User resolved it by upgrading to protobuf 3.20.0+, which introduced the missing ValueType attribute.

issues.title: [Bug] Worker started state is not reset after shutdown
issues.author: schibrikov
issues.summary: Worker's `_started` flag is not reset after shutdown, causing "Already started" error when attempting to run the worker again. However, workers are designed as single-use by intention, and users should create new worker instances instead of reusing them.

issues.title: [Bug] temporalio.worker.WorkflowReplayResult(s) not visible
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: The WorkflowReplayResult and WorkflowReplayResults classes are not publicly visible because they're defined in a private module and need to be re-exported from the main temporalio.worker module.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Clarify requirement of heartbeat timeout wrt cancellation
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Documentation should clarify that heartbeat timeout is a required configuration in addition to the heartbeat mechanism itself. This is a documentation enhancement to improve guidance for developers.

issues.title: types-protobuf dependency is still on 3.x, while package supports protobuf 4.x
issues.author: schibrikov
issues.summary: The types-protobuf dependency is pinned to 3.x while the SDK supports protobuf 4.x. Updating the version constraint from ~3.20 to >=3.20 would resolve typings conflicts with google-cloud-sdk and align with protobuf 4.x support.

issues.title: [Bug] logging adapter does not include extra attributes?
issues.author: jmdacruz
issues.summary: The Python SDK's logging adapter doesn't properly merge extra attributes passed to log calls. When using `extra` parameters in workflow and activity logging, a KeyError is raised because the adapter doesn't preserve these attributes through the logging context.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Access to invoking workflow in activity method
issues.author: bbkgh
issues.summary: User requested a way to access information about the invoking workflow from within an activity method. The issue was resolved by pointing to the existing temporalio.activity.info() function which provides workflow context.

issues.title: mutate workflow instance attributes from within activities that it executes
issues.author: AmirRezaSobhdel
issues.summary: User attempted to mutate workflow instance attributes from within executed activities, expecting reference-based behavior. This is not supportedactivities and workflows run in separate processes with serialized data exchange.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Improve workflow sandboxing suggestions
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to improve Python SDK workflow sandboxing by encouraging separate files for workflows, adding clearer exception messaging, improving SEO through README documentation, and updating samples to demonstrate best practices.

issues.title: Temporal CLI based ephemeral server
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: Implement a Temporal CLI-based ephemeral server for Python SDK testing instead of Temporalite. This requires support for additional namespaces and depends on CLI features and SDK core updates.

issues.title: [Bug] Health proto clashes with grpc_health library
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Health proto package in the Python SDK conflicts with the gRPC health library's health.proto, causing a TypeError when both are imported. The SDK's health proto package needs to be renamed to avoid this namespace collision.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Confirm async activity completion can give null value for Optional-return activity
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Test and confirm that async activities returning Optional types (e.g., Optional[str]) can properly complete with null/None values. Currently, the code may not explicitly put a null value in the result.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Properly list queries in query-handler-not-found error
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to improve the query-handler-not-found error by displaying a list of available queries in a space-delimited format within brackets. This will help the UI show possible queries when a query handler is not found.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Support JSON Type Converters
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Users need a way to customize JSON type conversion for their own types. The feature request proposes adding a JSONTypeConverter ABC to make it easier to convert between user types and JSON-able types during payload conversion.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Populate contextvars for threaded activities
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to propagate contextvars when executing threaded activities using asyncio.run_in_executor. Currently contextvars are not passed to the executor, requiring manual context population as a workaround since to_thread() doesn't use custom executors.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Reset Workflow
issues.author: bbkgh
issues.summary: User requests a code sample or guide for resetting workflows in the Python SDK, similar to tctl's reset functionality. The discussion reveals that while raw API access exists, there are no SDK samples for this advanced operation.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Workflow Versioning Documentation
issues.author: bbkgh
issues.summary: User requested documentation and guidance on workflow versioning in the Python SDK, following the TypeScript implementation pattern. The issue was resolved by redirecting to existing documentation and a related documentation issue.

issues.title: [Bug] Make sure start workflows throws WorkflowAlreadyStartedError if already running
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: StartWorkflow should throw WorkflowAlreadyStartedError when attempting to start a workflow that is already running, providing users with a clear, friendly error message instead of a generic failure.

issues.title: [Bug] PEP 604 style optionals not working properly
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: PEP 604 style optionals (using | for Union types) are not properly recognized in the converter module. The code needs to handle types.UnionType which is only available in Python 3.10+, and tests are needed to confirm proper support.

issues.title: [Bug] with_child_unrestricted not properly removing restriction
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: The with_child_unrestricted method in workflow sandbox restrictions has a bug where it fails to properly remove restrictions due to an incorrect condition check on child_path[0].

issues.title: [Feature Request] Warn/error on invalid query use
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Add validation warnings and errors for invalid query patterns in the Python SDK. Queries should warn if async, error if using workflow constructs like wait_condition, and error if creating commands.

issues.title: [Bug] Failure.encoded_attributes not being subjected to codec
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: The PayloadCodec.encode_failure and PayloadCodec.decode_failure methods are not applying codec transformations to the encoded_attributes field of Failure objects, which was missed in issue #185.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Mark local activities as experimental
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Local activities in the Python SDK are still experimental in core but lack documentation marking them as such in docstrings. This feature request asks to add experimental status documentation to local activities.

issues.title: [Bug] BrokenProcessPool completely disables ProcessPoolExecutor
issues.author: wilsoniya
issues.summary: When a worker process in ProcessPoolExecutor is terminated (e.g., segfault, OOMkill), the executor enters a BrokenProcessPool state that permanently disables activity execution. The worker cannot recover and continues failing all subsequent activities indefinitely.

issues.title: tokio-1.21.2.crate: 2 vulnerabilities (highest severity is: 9.8) - autoclosed
issues.author: app/mend-for-github-com
issues.summary: Tokio dependency (version 1.21.2) contains two security vulnerabilities: WS-2023-0027 (CVSS 9.8) affecting Pin contract soundness, and CVE-2023-22466 (CVSS 5.4) affecting Windows named pipe security. Issue was auto-closed after vulnerability was removed from the repository.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Support dynamic workflows, activities, signals, and queries
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Add support for dynamic workflows, activities, signals, and queries that can catch all invocations with a given name as a parameter. This requires opt-in registration and access to the payload converter for raw payload handling.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Opt-in to having stack trace query use custom data converter
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to add an opt-in worker option `stack_trace_query_uses_converter` that allows the stack trace query response to be processed through custom data converters. The feature was later abandoned.

issues.title: [Bug] Can't debugging workflow using vscode
issues.author: niros1
issues.summary: VSCode debugger attachment fails when running workflows due to a KeyError in the workflow sandbox's import system. The debugpy module tries to access the 'warnings' module through the sandbox's restricted module loader, which doesn't provide it, causing workflow execution to crash.

issues.title: [Bug] Activity cancellation error issues
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: The Python SDK cannot send a cancelled error to the server when cancellation is not explicitly requested, causing it to be converted to an application error. The SDK also needs to properly set the `ActivityExecutionResult.cancelled` flag when activities are cancelled.

issues.title: [Bug] Optional[X] type not being handled properly as parameter
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: The `inspect.isclass` check in temporalio/common.py doesn't properly handle `typing.Optional` (which is an alias for `typing.Union`), causing optional parameters with types like `Optional[X]` to not be handled correctly. The check needs to be removed and tests should validate that optional parameters work, including with Pydantic models.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Raise exception for payloads that violate gRPC message max size
issues.author: nathanielobrown
issues.summary: Feature request to raise clear exceptions when payload sizes exceed gRPC's 4MB maximum limit, instead of silently retrying and timing out. Currently, oversized payloads result in ResourceExhausted gRPC errors that are treated as transient and retried indefinitely, causing confusing timeouts without clear error messages.

issues.title: [Bug] Generic Nested Dataclasses not desrialized correctly
issues.author: ferntheplant
issues.summary: Generic nested dataclasses are deserialized as plain dictionaries instead of proper dataclass instances when used as activity parameters. This causes AttributeError when trying to access nested dataclass attributes.

issues.title: setuptools-65.3.0-py3-none-any.whl: 1 vulnerabilities (highest severity is: 5.9) - autoclosed
issues.author: app/mend-for-github-com
