issues.summary: Setuptools 65.3.0 contains a ReDoS vulnerability (CVE-2022-40897) in package_index.py that allows remote attackers to cause denial of service through malicious HTML in packages or custom package index pages. Fixed in setuptools 65.5.1.

issues.title: [Bug] Python 3.11 TypeError: Passing coroutines is forbidden, use tasks explicitly.
issues.author: AndrewIngram
issues.summary: Python 3.11 raises TypeError when passing coroutines directly to asyncio.wait(). The code works in Python 3.10 but fails in 3.11 due to stricter async API requirements. The solution is to use asyncio.wait_for() with a timeout instead.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Move the user-facing parts in temporalio.bridge.runtime to somewhere stable
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Move the stable user-facing APIs from the unstable temporalio.bridge.runtime package to a stable location, either at the top level or under temporalio.runtime or temporalio.common.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Confirm PyThreadState_SetAsyncExc is ok on non-GIL threads
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Verify that canceling sync activities running non-GIL code is safe in the Python SDK. This addresses a similar issue found in the Ruby SDK implementation.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Eagerly error when attempting to register a callable activity class instead of its instance
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to provide eager validation when registering an activity class instead of an instance, failing at worker registration time rather than at activity runtime.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Dynamic activity/workflow support
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to add support for dynamic activities and workflows in the Python SDK that can handle multiple different activities/workflows through a single handler function with variable arguments.

issues.title: [Bug] Protobuf version 3.19 does not have ValueType enum wrapper
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: HistoryEventFilterType.ValueType fails on protobuf 3.19 because the enum wrapper was not introduced until protobuf 3.20. The minimum protobuf dependency version needs to be updated.

issues.title: [Bug] grpcio not being treated as optional dependency
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: The grpcio dependency is not being marked as an optional dependency in the Python SDK's package metadata. The dependency is defined as 'grpc' in pyproject.toml but referenced as 'grpcio' in the wheel metadata, causing the optional extra to not be properly declared.

issues.title: [Bug] Deprecation Warning During Install
issues.author: mbernier
issues.summary: A deprecation warning appears when installing temporalio via pip due to grpcio being installed using the legacy setup.py method. This warning indicates that pip 23.1 will enforce stricter installation behavior.

issues.title: [Bug] Conflict using temporal-sdk with loguru
issues.author: northpowered
issues.summary: Using loguru library with temporal-sdk causes import errors in the workflow sandbox due to loguru extending restricted classes like datetime. The sandbox restrictions prevent loguru from loading properly during workflow initialization.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Disallow cross-namespace child workflow calls
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to remove the `namespace` option from child workflow calls in the Python SDK. Temporal plans to discontinue support for cross-namespace child workflow calls in favor of alternative approaches.

issues.title: [Bug] Importing gevent causes sandbox errors
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Importing gevent.os causes sandbox errors due to gevent's internal use of dict.items() on a restricted proxy object, which Python's C code rejects.

issues.title: [Feature Request] RPC error improvements
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Improve RPC error handling in the Python SDK by making RPC-based errors extend a common base class and properly exposing error details from the gRPC protocol. The solution involves making gRPC status information available with Any-typed details for developers to use when needed.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Confirm vscode debuggability within sandbox
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: User reported difficulty debugging Python SDK workflows while running in sandbox environment. Feature request to confirm and improve vscode debuggability within sandbox constraints.

issues.title: [Bug] Replayer README inaccurate
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: The Replayer README documentation is outdated and inaccurate regarding how to load workflow history from JSON. It needs to be updated with current client history fetching details.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Integration in django application
issues.author: AdrianPardo99
issues.summary: User seeks guidance on integrating Temporal worker and client into an existing Django application, transitioning from Zappa async tasks to Temporal workflows and activities.

issues.title: [Bug] Sandboxed classes should be able to extend restricted classes
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Sandboxed classes cannot extend restricted classes in the Python SDK, a known limitation that prevents certain inheritance patterns from working correctly.

issues.title: [Bug] Sandbox importer not respecting relative levels for pass through
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Sandbox importer fails to respect relative import levels when `__import__` is called with level > 0, causing issues during non-binary Pydantic installations. The importer needs to properly resolve module names for relative imports by calculating the fully qualified name based on the package context.

issues.title: [Bug] SandboxWorkflowRunner doesn't use correct Pydantic field types in some cases
issues.author: michael-cybrid
issues.summary: Pydantic models with datetime fields are incorrectly instantiated with date objects instead when created within workflows using the default sandbox runner. The issue is caused by the sandbox's datetime restriction logic incorrectly handling Pydantic's field type validation.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Make it easier to pass through third party modules
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to simplify importing third-party modules in workflow sandboxes. Currently requires configuring the sandbox runner with unstable APIs; proposal suggests adding a context manager, AST comments, or worker-level configuration for easier passthrough module specification.

issues.title: [Bug] Fix README to use workflow_runner instead of runner in sandbox examples
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: README documentation uses incorrect argument name 'runner' instead of 'workflow_runner' in sandbox examples, causing copy-paste errors for users following the guide.

issues.title: [Bug] Cannot even import concurrent.futures.ProcessPoolExecutor in sandbox
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Importing concurrent.futures.ProcessPoolExecutor or ThreadPoolExecutor in Python workflows causes workflow failure even when unused. The sandbox environment prevents these imports, requiring investigation into why these standard library imports are blocked.

issues.title: [Bug] Identity equality for int enum fails inside sandbox
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Identity equality checks (`is`) on IntEnum values fail when passed as workflow arguments because type conversion uses the definition's type hint instead of the sandbox's type context. This causes type mismatch issues for IntEnum and potentially isinstance checks on dataclasses.

issues.title: [Bug] OpenTelemetry sandbox issue on first load inside sandbox
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: OpenTelemetry fails on first use inside workflow sandbox because it tries to load configuration files, which are not allowed in the sandbox. This occurs when workers are separated from clients and OpenTelemetry context hasn't been initialized outside the sandbox first.

issues.title: [Bug] Bad metrics config type
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Type annotation error in metrics configuration where MetricsConfig type is incorrectly specified in the runtime bridge module.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Iterable Intermediate Results
issues.author: mikedh
issues.summary: User requests support for intermediate results from long-running iterable activities in Python SDK. Currently, activities can only return final results after completion, not stream intermediate values during execution.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Support patch search attribute
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to support patch search attributes in Python SDK, similar to Go's implementation using TemporalChangeVersion keys. Needs design decision on user-facing API for updating and retrieving individual search attributes.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Upsert memo support
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to add support for upserting memo in the Python SDK. The issue was acknowledged as being on the near-term backlog but remains unresolved.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Allow client headers to be mutated after creation
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to add a `Client.set_rpc_metadata` method to allow client headers to be mutated after the client is created, aligning with SDK Core's `set_headers` capability.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Unit test for protos as input/output of workflows in sandbox
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Need a unit test demonstrating protobuf serialization for workflow inputs/outputs in sandbox mode, with documentation explaining that protobufs must be added as passthrough modules due to protobuf static C state reloading issues.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Review options for allowing protobuf 3.x to work with this library
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Support for protobuf 3.x alongside 4.x in the Python SDK to address library compatibility issues. Users are encountering problems due to mixed protobuf version dependencies across the ecosystem, requiring investigation of multi-version code generation strategies.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Prefix private files/modules' filenames with underscore
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: IDE auto-complete is cluttered with private implementation modules that should be hidden. Proposal to prefix private module filenames with underscores to make them truly private and improve IDE experience for users.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Support string-based enum
issues.author: KMilhan
issues.summary: String-based enums in Python SDK are not properly serialized when passed to activities, resulting in incorrect type information (list instead of str). The feature request is to add native support for string-based enums to properly handle their serialization.

issues.title: V1 - is there any esitimation date for V1 ?
issues.author: niros1
issues.summary: User inquiring about the estimated release date for Python SDK V1. The issue was closed as it's a discussion topic rather than a technical issue.

issues.title: [Bug] Investigate "legacy query response along with other commands"
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Workflow completion fails with 'legacy query response along with other commands' error during dataclass typed workflow tests, particularly with Java test server. Investigation revealed this is caused by SDK-core issue #390.

issues.title: [Bug] Do not require timer to be present when fire-timer received
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Timer presence check is too strict when a signal cancels a timer in the same job activation. The timer may not exist if it was already cancelled, but the current code requires it to be present when fired.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Tests for Python 3.11 support
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Add CI tests to confirm Python 3.11 support is working. This is a testing infrastructure enhancement to validate compatibility with Python 3.11.

issues.title: [Bug] Query return type hint not being validated against
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Query return type validation was not being enforced during decode operations. Issue was investigated and appears to be working correctly.

issues.title: [Bug] Wrap query RPC error with friendlier error
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Python SDK throws raw RPC errors for non-existent queries instead of wrapping them with user-friendly error messages like other SDKs do. This should be improved to provide clearer error context to users.

issues.title: github.com/temporalio/temporalite-v0.0.0-20220801155940-a4b633da82bc: 1 vulnerabilities (highest severity is: 7.5) - autoclosed
issues.author: app/mend-for-github-com
issues.summary: Transitive dependency vulnerability in golang.org/x/net (CVE-2022-27664) causing potential HTTP/2 connection hangs during shutdown. High severity DoS risk from Go net package used in temporalite dependency.

issues.title: [Bug] OpenTelemetry interceptors report errors
issues.author: anhdle14
issues.summary: OpenTelemetry interceptors in the Python SDK fail with a 'Failed to detach context' ValueError when the event loop is garbage collected during workflow execution, particularly on worker exit when context variables from different contexts collide.

issues.title: [Bug] Function type hint lookup cache key is bad
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Function type hint lookup uses `__qualname__` as cache key, which is not unique across same-named classes in different scopes. Additionally, `typing.Set` and similar typing wrappers are excluded from return type hints because they don't satisfy `inspect.isclass`.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Integration test for Otel gRPC metrics collector
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to add an integration test confirming the OpenTelemetry gRPC URL format and TLS support for metrics collection in the Python SDK. After investigation, the implementation was deferred to the samples repository.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Remove custom Go server
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to remove the custom Go server used for testing in the Python SDK, replacing it with Temporalite which now has search attribute cache disabling and proper TLS base config override capabilities.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Add metric temporality to telemetry config
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Request to add metric temporality configuration to telemetry settings, aligning with changes made in the core SDK. This is a duplicate of issue #141.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Support multi-workflow replayer
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Support replaying multiple workflows by adding lazy history fetching and modifying the replayer to accept an iterable of histories instead of a single history, enabling efficient streaming of workflow histories.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Rework search attributes and add list endpoint to client
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Rework search attributes to support individual, per-type attributes with collections only for keywords, and expose a workflow listing API on the client as a lazy iterator.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Custom failure converters
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Request for custom failure converters in the Python SDK, similar to implementations in TypeScript and Go SDKs. This feature allows developers to customize how exceptions are converted to Temporal failures.

issues.title: [Bug] Telemetry not initialized for replayer
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Telemetry initialization fails when using the replayer without a client, causing a panic exception about uninitialized metrics.

issues.title: [Bug] Potential issue with parallel activities
issues.author: nediamond
issues.summary: When one activity in a parallel asyncio.gather() fails, it causes the entire workflow to fail and cancels remaining activities, preventing their successful results from being saved to workflow history. Users expected successful activity completions to be persisted even when other parallel activities fail.

issues.title: [Bug] "History is out of order" reported when running two workers for the same queue
issues.author: imsut
issues.summary: Running two workers for the same task queue in a single Python process causes a "History is out of order" fatal error in the workflow engine. The user was attempting to achieve task priority by running multiple workers on the same queue, but this configuration triggers an ordering issue in the event history.

issues.title: Clarify story around using a client from a different asyncio loop than it was created in
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Users reported that clients created in one asyncio event loop may not work properly if used in a different event loop. The issue requests clarification, documentation, and potentially error handling around this behavior.

issues.title: Clarify story around sync activity cancellation
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Improve the API and mechanism for sync activity cancellation in Python SDK. Currently requires throwing CancelledError, but the team decided to implement PyThreadState_SetAsyncExc by default with options to disable or shield from thread exceptions.

issues.title: [Bug] Cancelled workflow returns WorkflowExecutionStatus.FAILED status in workflow description
issues.author: lambyqq
issues.summary: When a workflow is cancelled, the status returned by `wf_handle.describe().status` incorrectly shows `WorkflowExecutionStatus.FAILED` instead of `WorkflowExecutionStatus.CANCELED`. The SDK is using `fail_workflow_execution` instead of `cancel_workflow_execution`.

issues.title: Search attribute Datetime need to support full ISO 8601 (and maybe more)
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: The Python SDK's search attribute datetime parsing using `datetime.fromisoformat` fails to parse ISO 8601 strings with 'Z' timezone designator (RFC3339Nano format). This breaks workflow scheduling when the Temporal server sends timestamps like '2022-10-30T06:28:30Z'.

issues.title: Pydantic models with nested non-JSON-friendly field types cannot be serialized
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Pydantic models with nested non-JSON-serializable field types (like UUID lists) cannot be serialized because `dict()` doesn't produce JSON-friendly output. The SDK needs to handle custom types or provide workarounds for users.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Support FailureConverter concept
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to implement FailureConverter concept in Python SDK, aligning with TypeScript SDK implementation (PR #887). This depends on completing work in issue #164.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Support Otel temporality config
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to expose OpenTelemetry temporality configuration from sdk-core to the Python SDK, allowing users to control how metrics are aggregated over time.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Better title and favicon for python.temporal.io
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: Feature request to improve the Python SDK documentation site (python.temporal.io) with a better page title and custom favicon for better browser tab visibility and consistency with other SDK documentation sites.

issues.title: Expose default sequence of payload converters for custom converter creators
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Request to expose the default sequence of payload converters so users can reference it when creating custom converters. Also requests making it easier to create a data converter with a different encoding payload converter prepended to the defaults.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Extend readme contents about exception from activity
issues.author: KMilhan
issues.summary: User requested better documentation about exception handling in activities, specifically which exceptions cause failures, retries, and how to use ApplicationError in activities similar to workflows.

issues.title: temporal-sdk-core-protos-0.1.0: 1 vulnerabilities (highest severity is: 7.5) - autoclosed
issues.author: app/mend-for-github-com
issues.summary: Transitive dependency vulnerability (CVE-2022-3212) in axum-core 0.2.7 allows denial of service through unbounded request body handling. Detected in temporal-sdk-core-protos dependency chain.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Apply codecs to `Failure.encodedAttributes`
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: The recently added Payload field in the Failure message needs to be processed through payload codecs, similar to other failure attributes. This is a follow-up to add codec support for encoded attributes.

issues.title: [Feature Request] client.OutboundInterceptor should support get_workflow_execution_history()
issues.author: lambyqq
issues.summary: OutboundInterceptor does not support get_workflow_execution_history() method calls, preventing custom interceptors from running on workflow result retrieval operations. User needs interceptor support for runtime modifications like adding hostname-pid suffixes to workflow IDs in shared testing namespaces.

issues.title: [Bug] conditions are triggered when processing queries and patch notifications
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: Conditions are incorrectly triggered when processing queries and patch notifications in Python SDK, causing unwanted commands to be generated. This issue was previously fixed in TypeScript SDK and needs the same fix applied to Python.

issues.title: Add support for Pydantic's secret types
issues.author: averri
issues.summary: User requests support for Pydantic's SecretStr and SecretField types to protect sensitive data from appearing in Temporal logs and UI. The issue was resolved by directing users to use custom data converters for encryption rather than implementing Pydantic-specific support in the SDK.

issues.title: The SDK is failing to serialize objects from Pydantic classes
issues.author: averri
issues.summary: Pydantic BaseModel objects fail to serialize to JSON in the Python SDK, causing workflows to crash with 'not JSON serializable' errors. The issue was resolved by implementing a Pydantic encoder in the SDK's converter.

issues.title: Mark global tracing options as experimental
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Mark global tracing/telemetry options as experimental to signal that the API may change. Currently, telemetry configuration is process-global through `temporalio.bridge.telemetry`, but the team wants to enable worker-specific settings in the future.

issues.title: Do not require ID for child workflow invocation
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Child workflow invocation currently requires explicit workflow IDs. This feature request proposes making workflow IDs optional for in-workflow child workflow invocation, with automatic UUID generation as the default.

issues.title: Update Python proto library to latest
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Request to upgrade Python proto library from 3.x to support both 3.x and 4.x versions, similar to Pulumi's approach. Discussion includes considerations about gRPC version compatibility and memory leak concerns.

issues.title: Remove abbreviations in options
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Remove abbreviated option names in worker configuration to improve clarity. Options like `max_concurrent_wft_polls` should be renamed to `max_concurrent_workflow_task_polls` and `max_concurrent_at_polls` to `max_concurrent_activity_task_polls`.

issues.title: Convert all tests to use test framework and multiple server forms
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Refactor all Python SDK tests to use a test framework with multiple server forms instead of the current Go-based binary wrapper. This involves converting client/workflow tests to use injected test environments, updating activity tests, and running CI tests against both time-skipping and Temporalite test servers.

issues.title: Remove callable as accepted client interceptor type
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Remove the Callable shortcut from client interceptor type union. The interceptor type currently accepts both Interceptor objects and Callables that transform OutboundInterceptors, but this shortcut is unnecessary and should be removed.

issues.title: Do not convert history JSON enums if already done
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Avoid redundant JSON enum conversion in history processing when enums have already been converted. The SDK should detect and skip re-conversion to improve performance and prevent potential issues.

issues.title: [Bug] Client.get_workflow_handle_for not properly setting result type
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: The `get_workflow_handle_for` method does not properly extract and set the result type on the returned workflow handle. Additionally, the `result_type` parameter should be allowed on `get_workflow_handle` for users who know the type.

issues.title: [Bug] Search attributes require specific non-documented format
issues.author: adrianbeloqui
issues.summary: User encountered an error when setting search attributes with non-title-case keys in child workflows. After investigation, it was determined that search attributes must match the names registered on the server, not a format requirement.

issues.title: [Bug] Setting memo on executing child flow
issues.author: adrianbeloqui
issues.summary: Setting a memo parameter on `execute_child_workflow` throws a ValueError due to improper protobuf message assignment. The Python proto SDK requires lazy field access for submessages rather than direct assignment to map fields.

issues.title: Add max task queue activities per second
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Add support for max task queue activities per second rate limiting in Python SDK, matching functionality already available in TypeScript SDK.

issues.title: [Feature Request] UUID support as an arg
issues.author: KMilhan
issues.summary: User requests native UUID support for activity arguments in Python SDK. Currently UUID raises a JSON serialization error, but many Python libraries treat UUID as JSON serializable via string representation.

issues.title: Change child workflow cancel to issue the one command
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Simplify child workflow cancellation by using a single command instead of issuing different commands based on whether the child workflow has started. This was enabled by sdk-core PR #379.

issues.title: Ensure accepted iterables are iterated eagerly and stored as lists
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: The SDK currently accepts iterables but may store them without consuming, which is problematic for single-use iterables. The request is to convert all accepted iterables into lists eagerly, or preferably accept Sequence types instead of Iterable everywhere to align with other Python libraries.

issues.title: Support timedelta | float | int for all user-facing duration input
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Request to accept timedelta, float, or int for all user-facing duration inputs across the Python SDK. Currently only wait_condition accepts floats; other APIs require timedeltas. The request was closed as won't fix due to API confusion concerns, but the author committed to accepting both types where floats are already supported for consistency.

issues.title: go.temporal.io/server-v1.17.1: 6 vulnerabilities (highest severity is: 7.5) - autoclosed
issues.author: app/mend-for-github-com
issues.summary: Mend security scan detected 6 vulnerabilities in go.temporal.io/server-v1.17.1 transitive dependencies, including 4 high-severity CVEs (CVSS 7.5) affecting Apache Thrift, golang.org/x/net, and golang.org/x/text libraries. The issue was automatically closed by Mend as the vulnerable library was removed from inventory.

issues.title: [Feature Request] `retry_policy` on `continue_as_new`
issues.author: patte
issues.summary: Feature request to add `retry_policy` parameter to `continue_as_new()` so that retry policies can be carried over across workflow continuations. Currently, when a workflow continues as new, the server doesn't carry over retry policy settings, causing workflows to fail with `RetryPolicyNotSet` instead of respecting the original retry configuration.

issues.title: Per-call gRPC options
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to enable per-call gRPC configuration for timeouts and headers in the Python SDK, allowing developers to customize gRPC behavior on a per-call basis rather than globally.

issues.title: Linux aarch64 wheel
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Test and validate the Linux aarch64 wheel build, which is disabled in CI due to long build times. Resolve the issue that protoc-wheel-0 doesn't have a Linux aarch64 wheel, preventing protoc installation in this environment.

issues.title: Expose operator service raw grpc API
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: Request to expose the operator service raw gRPC API in the Python SDK, allowing direct access to operator service functionality.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Lazy connectivity for client and healthCheck
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: Feature request to implement lazy connectivity for the Python SDK client and health checks. The issue discusses design challenges with making client connection lazy when worker creation is synchronous, and proposes requiring lazy connectivity support in the core SDK.

issues.title: Immediate start-then-cancel not working properly
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: When a workflow is started and immediately cancelled, the primary task gets cancelled before the workflow code runs, preventing the cancelled event from being caught. The fix requires deferring the task cancellation to the event loop so user code can execute and respond to cancellation.

issues.title: Timed out wait_condition futures still attempt setting result
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: When a wait_condition times out and then later receives a successful bool result, attempting to set the result on the already-timed-out future raises an InvalidStateError.

issues.title: github.com/temporalio/temporal-v1.17.1: 3 vulnerabilities (highest severity is: 7.5) - autoclosed
issues.author: app/mend-for-github-com
issues.summary: Mend security vulnerability report for Apache Thrift transitive dependency (v0.10.0) with 3 vulnerabilities including 2 high-severity issues (CVE-2019-0205, CVE-2019-0210) affecting availability and 1 medium-severity issue (CVE-2018-11798) affecting confidentiality. Issue was autoclosed as the vulnerable dependency is no longer part of the inventory.

issues.title: High level API for schedules
issues.author: bergundy
issues.summary: Request for a high-level API to create and manage Temporal schedules in the Python SDK.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Ability to install without having Rust installed
issues.author: crubier
issues.summary: Python SDK required Rust installation for pip installation on unsupported platforms, complicating deployment. The issue was resolved by publishing pre-built wheels for common platforms (Windows x64, macOS x64/arm64, Linux x64) so Rust is only needed for rare environments.

issues.title: [Bug] M1 Mac grpcio error
issues.author: ashwin-borneo
issues.summary: M1 Mac users encounter import errors with grpcio when running Temporal Python workers. The issue was resolved by installing grpcio via conda instead of pip.

issues.title: Add README info for how to disable deadlock detector
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Request to add README documentation explaining how to disable the deadlock detector in the Python SDK.

issues.title: Replayer
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Implement a workflow replayer for the Python SDK to enable history replay and JSON parsing/fixing capabilities, which is a blocking feature for production use.

issues.title: Test framework
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Request to create a test framework for the Python SDK that leverages the test server. This is a foundational testing infrastructure feature needed to support test development across the SDK.

issues.title: Create workflow sandbox
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Implement a workflow sandbox environment to run workflows with certain operations disabled, preventing non-deterministic behavior. Research on this capability has already begun.

issues.title: Accept `host:port` for client instead of only URL
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Python SDK should accept `host:port` format for client configuration instead of requiring full URLs, aligning with other SDKs. The tls_config parameter should be updated to handle both boolean and TLSConfig options.

issues.title: Improve dataclass type hinting
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: The Python SDK's dataclass type hinting support is too limited. Currently only supports basic object conversion via dacite, but lacks support for collections, mappings, unions, and optionals. The team decided to implement a custom JSON deserializer based on pyserde that respects type hints without requiring decorators.

issues.title: Properly treat activity/child cancellation errors bubbled as workflow cancel
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Workflow cancellation is not properly reported when activity or child workflow cancellation errors bubble up. The Python SDK should convert these errors to workflow cancellation, similar to how TypeScript SDK handles it.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Inject dependencies into activities
issues.author: gregbrowndev
issues.summary: User requests a way to inject request/job-specific dependencies (like database sessions) into activity functions without creating circular import issues. The issue discusses various approaches including factory patterns and bootstrap functions, with uncertainty about best practices for async Python applications.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Get workflow handle/send signals from non-async code
issues.author: nathanielobrown
issues.summary: User requested synchronous versions of workflow signal and handle APIs to call from non-async activities, but was clarified that activities use the client API instead, not the workflow package.

issues.title: [Bug] retry_policy not availably in activity info
issues.author: nathanielobrown
issues.summary: Activity info does not expose the retry_policy passed to execute_activity. User wants to access retry policy from within an activity to implement conditional error handling and observability (e.g., logging errors only on final retries).

issues.title: temporal-sdk-core-0.1.0: 1 vulnerabilities (highest severity is: 7.5) - autoclosed
issues.author: app/mend-for-github-com
issues.summary: High-severity vulnerability (CVE-2023-22895, CVSS 7.5) in transitive dependency bzip2-0.4.3 used by temporal-sdk-core-0.1.0 allows denial of service through integer overflow. Enterprise customers unable to adopt SDK due to security policy restrictions.

issues.title: Interceptor header and OpenTelemetry support
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Add support for headers on interceptors and create an OpenTelemetry module with an interceptor for proper span handling throughout the SDK, with testing across SDKs.

issues.title: Investigate issues with gevent.monkey.patch_all()
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Users reported that calling gevent.monkey.patch_all() breaks workflow asyncio on gevent 1.5.0. The issue stems from gevent monkey-patching pure Python threading but not the C implementation, causing conflicts with the custom asyncio event loop management. The solution involved creating a separate executor for running the asyncio event loop in a native gevent thread.

issues.title: Deserialize traceback from stack trace string in Temporal failures if able
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Feature request to deserialize Python tracebacks from stack trace strings in Temporal failures. The SDK should parse stack trace strings back into traceback objects similar to how the Java SDK does, allowing better error context preservation and logging.

issues.title: Remove gRPC dependency
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Remove gRPC as a regular dependency since the Python SDK uses a Core client instead. Keep gRPC as a dev dependency for testing purposes only.

issues.title: temporal-sdk-core-api-0.1.0: 1 vulnerabilities (highest severity is: 5.5) - autoclosed
issues.author: app/mend-for-github-com
issues.summary: Transitive dependency rustix-0.38.8 contains a medium severity vulnerability (CVSS 5.5) that can cause memory explosion in the Dir iterator with the linux_raw backend. The issue is in a deep dependency chain through temporal-sdk-core-api and affects the Python SDK build.

issues.title: [Feature Request] Support non-function callables as activities
issues.author: llchan
issues.summary: Support for non-function callables as activities by using Python's inspect module instead of relying on __code__ attribute. This expands the types of callables that can be used as Temporal activities.

issues.title: Properly report version
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: The Python SDK should properly report its version. Currently references a hardcoded version location in the bridge client that may not reflect the actual SDK version.

issues.title: Improve workflow stack trace query result
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Stack traces for workflow queries are currently poor quality. The request is to improve them, ideally without significant performance impact.

issues.title: Add more robust docs to docstrings
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Add more comprehensive docstrings at the module and package level to improve documentation and usage guidance for the Python SDK. The enhancement aims to provide clearer explanation of how to use each package, with optional examples.

issues.title: Add build docs to README
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: README lacks documentation on how to build the SDK from source as a dependency. Users need clear instructions on cloning recursively (including the sdk-core git submodule) and using the locally-built version.

issues.title: Put public doc links in docstrings
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Request to add public documentation links throughout Python SDK docstrings to help users discover available documentation. The author decided against this approach due to documentation headings changing frequently.

issues.title: Publish to pip
issues.author: vincent-lecrubier-skydio
issues.summary: Request to publish the Python SDK to PyPI package registry. The team needs the package available for integration into their main repository rather than building from scratch.

issues.title: github.com/temporalio/temporal-v1.14.4: 4 vulnerabilities (highest severity is: 7.5) - autoclosed
issues.author: app/mend-for-github-com
issues.summary: Four security vulnerabilities detected in transitive dependencies of temporalio/temporal v1.14.4, including high-severity issues in Apache Thrift and Prometheus client library that could lead to denial of service attacks.

issues.title: Move from Sphinx API docs to pydoctor
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Move from Sphinx to pydoctor for API documentation generation. Requires upstreaming support for @overload decorator to pydoctor, then making the existing gen-docs-pydoctor alternative the default and removing Sphinx.

issues.title: More workflow tests
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Request to add more comprehensive workflow tests to the Python SDK. The issue references TODO items in test files that outline additional test cases needed.

issues.title: Versioning/Patching
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Request to implement Python SDK patching functionality equivalent to the TypeScript SDK's patching feature documented at https://docs.temporal.io/typescript/patching

issues.title: Search attributes
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Request for full search attribute support on the Python SDK client and within workflows, with proper type safety for search attributes.

issues.title: Propagate fatal worker errors
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Fatal worker errors need to propagate out of run() method so developers can handle them, particularly for async context managers where error communication is otherwise limited.

issues.title: Async activity support
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Request to add async activity support to the Python SDK for both client-side activity execution and activity implementation. This enhancement would enable users to write async activities and execute them asynchronously.

issues.title: Stress tests
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Need repeatable, parameterized stress tests to understand default maximums and resource utilization under heavy workflow load. Tests should run in CI with lower parameters but be configurable for actual system stress testing.

issues.title: Roadmap
issues.author: Xakt
issues.summary: User inquires about the Python SDK roadmap and timeline for production readiness, moving beyond alpha stage. The maintainer responds that development is split into three phases with Phase 1 complete and Phase 2 under active development, targeting beta status soon.

issues.title: temporal-client-0.1.0: 1 vulnerabilities (highest severity is: 7.5) - autoclosed
issues.author: app/mend-for-github-com
issues.summary: Security vulnerability in transitive dependency: CVE-2022-24713 in regex-1.5.4 crate (CVSS 7.5) causes denial of service through specially crafted regular expressions. This was automatically closed after the vulnerable library was removed from the project inventory.

issues.title: go.temporal.io/server-v1.14.4: 4 vulnerabilities (highest severity is: 7.5) - autoclosed
issues.author: app/mend-for-github-com
issues.summary: Security vulnerability report for go.temporal.io/server-v1.14.4 with 4 transitive dependency vulnerabilities (3 high, 1 medium severity) in Apache Thrift and Prometheus client. Issue was auto-closed as the vulnerable libraries are no longer part of the inventory.

issues.title: Multiprocess heartbeat and cancel improvement research
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Multiprocess heartbeat and cancellation mechanism using multiprocessing.Manager() is flaky and confusing. The current implementation moves heartbeats through sync queues to async tasks, and fast heartbeating can block the event loop.

issues.title: Test client/worker/core behavior across fork
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: The Python SDK's behavior with fork() is undefined and fails unpredictably, particularly with gRPC client file descriptors that cause crashes during garbage collection in child processes. The request is to ensure fork() either works cleanly without leaks or fails explicitly when attempting to use forked resources.

issues.title: Investigate more generic manylinux support
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Investigate support for more generic manylinux tags to build Python wheels compatible with a wider range of Linux distributions and glibc versions. Currently using manylinux_2_31 which limits compatibility.

issues.title: Support macOS arm64
issues.author: cretz
issues.summary: Add support for macOS arm64 (Apple Silicon) by building and testing prebuilt wheels on this platform. This requires updating CI configuration and resolving pyo3 cross-compilation challenges.
